summary: EVENFLO ODYSSEY V CHILD RESTRAINT: THE INSTALLATION GUIDE STATES ON PAGE 11: POSITIONING THE HARNESS STRAP, "FORWARD FACING, YOU MUST USE THE TOP HARNESS POSITION." ON PAGE 12 HOWEVER, UNDER CHECK LIST FOR A PROPERLY SECURED CHILD, IT STATES, "SHOULDER HARNESS STRAPS SHOULD BE AT OR ABOVE THE  SHOULDERS FOR FORWARD FACING."  WE WERE UNAWARE OF THE EXCLUSIVE USE OF THE TOP HARNESS POSITION REQUIRED ON MANY CAR SEATS IN THE FORWARD FACING POSITION UNTIL READING AN ARTICLE IN THE MARCH 2003 ISSUE OF AMERICAN BABY MAGAZINE. THEY STATED THIS IS ONE OF THE MOST COMMON ERRORS AND WHEN WE CHECKED THE EVENFLO GUIDE, WE FOUND THE CONFLICTING INSTRUCTIONS. SINCE WE HAD USED THE CHECKLIST TO COMPLETE OUR INSTALLATION, WE HAD THE HARNESS STRAPS ADJUSTED TO SHOULDER HEIGHT RATHER THAT IN THE TOP POSITION.   WE HAVE CORRECTED THE HARNESS POSITION, BUT ARE CONCERNED THAT OTHER PARENTS MAY HAVE MADE THE SAME MISTAKE BASED ON THE INSTRUCTIONS PROVIDED IN THE EVENFLO GUIDE.*JB
